comment.author: 60167946@N05
comment._content: Portrait by John Kay after a painting by George Romney (1792) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Thomas_Paine.jpg. Kay retains the likeness of Paine if not the political message of the original (where he holds a manuscript copy of his 'Rights of Man'). Likely copied from William Sharp's engraving, Kay's inverted copy (suggestion he traced out his portrait from Sharp's engraving) attests to the desire to know what the infamous Paine looked like.
